title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
Agenda

Process Optimization: EJ ü§ù EctJ
Challenges: Computing Power (Where to Stop)
Performance Report

title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
1. Process Optimization

Together with Brooke and Jaap Abbring (ME of EctJ) we worked to harmonize data policies of EJ and EctJ.
Same London based team handles both journals now, so streamlining processes is beneficial.
We have almost identical data policies now.

title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
Challenges: Computing Power
Nuvolos Subscription


We paid 2100 Euros for a nuvolos subscription in June 2023 (term until June 2024).
69120 CPU hours (single vCPU) in total. We‚Äôve spent 48911 so far, i.e.¬†70%. üëç
We need a slightly larger subscription next year, particularly large file storage.
The service is excellent value for money.









Where To Stop?


Applications, particularly those relying on machine learning methods, require vast computing power. Does it make sense to attempt full reproducibility checks?

text:

title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
Challenges: Computing Power
Budgeting


Running Reproducibility Checks in-house (running them anywhere) costs money.
Labor costs and costs of computing power üìà.
(Costs of Licenses?)
I suggest thinking about a slightly larger budget to cover those costs.
I strongly suggest to renew the nuvolos subscription.

title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
Processing Times






Stayed below 15 day mark.
Right direction üìâ.

title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
Revisions Per Paper






80% of papers fail in first round.
Hazard still 50% in second round.

on average 1h per iteration, 2 iterations per paper üëâ 2h per paper.

title: EJ Data Editor Report April 2024
text:
Data Availability





Confidential (üëâ for us: complicated) Data is on the rise.
Temporary Access is a good solution for us.
Partial and temp. only are the exception.
We changed policy slightly to encourage temp access.
